        subscribe
      • subscribe[T](self: IObservable[T]; onNext: (T) -> void; onError: (Error) -> void = doNothing[Error]; onCompleted: () -> void = doNothing): IDisposable

Types

Error = ref object
  msg: string

Observer[T] = ref object
  onNext*: (T) -> void
  onError*: (Error) -> void
  onCompleted*: () -> void

IObservable[T] = ref object
  onSubscribe*: Observer[T] -> IDisposable
  hasAnyObservers*: () -> bool
  removeObserver*: (Observer[T]) -> void

IDisposable = ref object
  dispose*: () -> void

Procs

proc newError(msg: string): Error {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc `$`(e: Error): string {....raises: [], tags: [].}
proc newSubscription[T](iObservable: IObservable[T]; observer: Observer[T]): IDisposable
proc newObserver[T](onNext: (T) -> void;
                    onError: (Error) -> void = doNothing[Error];
                    onCompleted: () -> void = doNothing): Observer[T]
proc subscribe[T](self: IObservable[T]; observer: Observer[T]): IDisposable

Templates

template subscribe[T](self: IObservable[T]; onNext: (T) -> void;
                      onError: (Error) -> void = doNothing[Error];
                      onCompleted: () -> void = doNothing): IDisposable
The sugar to:
discard someObservable
  .subscribe(newObserver(
    (v: T) => onNext(v),
    (e: Error) => onError(e),
    () => onCompleted()
  ))

It enable us to write:

discard someObservable
  .subscribe(
    (v: T) => onNext(v),
    (e: Error) => onError(e),
    () => onCompleted()
  )
